intro: Pedicularis sudetica var. bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking red and yellow flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with a dense layer of fine hairs. This variety is notable for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, often growing in alpine or subalpine environments.
